metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125025 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in FFmpeg 2.0. This affects the function decode_pulses. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

notes.Note: ccdm94> vulnerable function in file libavcodec/aacdec_template.c if not available in libavcodec/aacdec_template.c.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
